name: Anna-Karin Tornberg
content:
Anna-Karin Tornberg is a Swedish mathematician currently at Royal Institute of Technology who was awarded the Göran Gustafsson Prize and Leslie Fox Prize for Numerical Analysis and elected to the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences. Her research concerns computational mathematics.[1]
 As a faculty member at New York University in 2006, Tornberg won a Sloan Research Fellowship.[2] She was an invited speaker on numerical analysis and scientific computing at the 2018 International Congress of Mathematicians.[3] She is an alumnus of the Global Young Academy[4]
 
 This article about a Swedish mathematician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.

raw:
Swedish mathematician
Anna-Karin Tornberg is a Swedish mathematician currently at Royal Institute of Technology who was awarded the Göran Gustafsson Prize and Leslie Fox Prize for Numerical Analysis and elected to the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences. Her research concerns computational mathematics.[1]
As a faculty member at New York University in 2006, Tornberg won a Sloan Research Fellowship.[2] She was an invited speaker on numerical analysis and scientific computing at the 2018 International Congress of Mathematicians.[3] She is an alumnus of the Global Young Academy[4]

References[edit]


^ "Anna-Karin Tornberg". kth.se. Retrieved April 25, 2017.

^ "Past Fellows". Sloan Foundation. Retrieved 2019-09-09.

^ "Invited section lectures", ICM 2018, archived from the original on 2017-10-25, retrieved 2018-08-08

^ Anna-Karin Tornberg, Global Young Academy, retrieved 2020-06-01
